channel.title: A good RSPS - Economy
channel.description:
Hey MoparScape,
What do you guys thing a good RSPS, I'm currently making one. It's going to be based off of 2006 RuneScape, but it isn't a remake like a lot of people start and never complete. It's going to have the RuneScape combat and skills 100% perfected. But it isn't going to have all the other things. I will eventaully add all of the RS F2P Quests but that will be as far as I go. Now what I need to know from you guys is [B]What makes a good RSPS[/B].
Here are some things I have in mind;
- x7 RuneScape Experience. - A really good economy. - Hard way to obtain really expensive Items. - No massive bonuses for donators. - No half-assed programming.
So, please tell me what you think makes a good RSPS so I can think about it.
Thanks.
Thanks,
Skyro. ;)

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:30, topic:445627”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=548454.msg4022368#msg4022368 date=1340111883]

And of course ban trading of milk. (All milk in RS in unpasteurized).

And have me lose my job? No thank you.
[/quote]
Why can’t I turn RS into a bureaucratic nightmare? The whole food situation is a nightmare. Raw meat is sold without any form of control. Milk could have be stored with camel dung without you knowing it. And then we have the inhumane slaughter of cows and chickens. Overfishing is also a big problem in the game, since there is no control of the sustainability of the ocean and rivers. If we don’t do anything about now, it could soon be to late.

So if you want to make a good server, do the opposite of everything on the 100. point list, and regulate the food marked.[/quote]

But disease is not c0d3d into the game so we don’t have to worry about regulations! Just c0de more fish.

Problem solved.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

m1lkman:

[quote]And of course ban trading of milk. (All milk in RS in unpasteurized).

And have me lose my job? No thank you.[/quote]
Why can’t I turn RS into a bureaucratic nightmare? The whole food situation is a nightmare. Raw meat is sold without any form of control. Milk could have be stored with camel dung without you knowing it. And then we have the inhumane slaughter of cows and chickens. Overfishing is also a big problem in the game, since there is no control of the sustainability of the ocean and rivers. If we don’t do anything about now, it could soon be to late.

So if you want to make a good server, do the opposite of everything on the 100. point list, and regulate the food marked.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:27, topic:445627”]@JavaTC
I actually have to somewhat disagree with one of your statements and that’s the using smffy and other things to make your forums. I agree, using SMFFY is pretty pitiful because you basically throw it up, but I used Forumotion for about 5 months on my first server, it was great and it still is IF YOU USE IT RIGHT. You can actually make custom HTML pages along with CSS. That’s actually how I learned HTML and CSS. :3

So the long of the short, if you use those site right, they can be good. But if you don’t yea it’s shit…[/quote]
I didn’t post that part, it was a massive quote train we made one day that I saved.
Free forums are pretty pitiful, forummotion is okay at times, still suck though.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:25, topic:445627”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=548454.msg4022473#msg4022473 date=1340121292]
Here’s a list of what makes a good server that we the peoples of moparscape made one day

0. Custom Items
1. Spawn everything
2. Donators can spawn overpowered items
3. Abusing admins
4. Abusing mods
5. Dupes
6. Lag
7. leeched
8. Retarded community
9. Servers that even forget to change the name
10. Racist people
11. Server must have uberprosuperawesome and the letter x in its name
12. All the shops in 1 building like the party room.
13. Prefect ring
14. Monsters with less HP then needed
15. More staff then players
16. get moderator and admin powers by begging like a bitch
17. Owners must use ::hail more than 8 times within an hour
18. You can buy co-ownership for 15 bucks.
19. Server has to restart every 30 minutes.
20. Owner must use ::god to be super cool
21. forums is half-assed and looks like shit
22. random message every 15mins making u vote
23. thieving stalls, and ores are around the corner of home.
24. home is edge.
25. owners yell tag is "BEST CODER IN THE WORLD:"
26. every1 can yell.
27. Equivalent economy to present day america's.
28. NPCs shout the name of the owner.
29. ::skill1 ::skill2 ::skill3 to train skills.
30. ::train ::train2 ::train3 to train combat.
31. Every time you login a window pops up with the zillion commands you can use.
32. noclip.
33. owners name always contains the word "owner"
34. the "coders" act all big
35. name starts with "scape"
36. Coowner has access to the VPS
37. .tk domain
38. Advertise on every forum and every board in the forums
39. Advertise on runescape
40. Make a facebook page for it
41. make twitter page.
42. Get mod to get 5 players.
43. Or get stuff when you advertise.
44. Free rares for first 5 people on
45. Drop party everytime the server gets 20 people online
46. Servers that use mybannermaker.com for banners
47. In the description of their server, they put 'working DClaws' 3 different times.
48. Server in which have a vote command because they can't get people to vote normally.
49. Servers with custom log in messages that look horrible
50. Servers with mage that doesn't require level or runes
51. Servers with no need for arrows with bows
52. Banners are always a pic of some type of weapon spec.                                                                                                
53. Advertisements have around 50 pictures of random shit or useless features                                                                                                
54. Pictures of real runescape used for advertisement                                                                                            
55. Servers that make you manually save                                                                                        
56. Servers that say they are #1 server in the world even though they are ranked 800+ on a toplist
57. Servers that say they are using vps but using home internet.
58. PI.                                                                                
59. Dildos as swords, That can be use to probe cows(Cj would get the joke)
60. People who call their server, their own "game"
61. Owners never even heard of Java.                                                                    
62. Owners are 13 year olds who can't even spell or type a sentence with no errors                                                                    
63. Owners who threaten to RAT you because you correct them on their grammar mistakes                                                                
64. Owners don't have any protection and get ddosed by the members who demand staff..                                                            
65. Community is full of members who demand staff.                                                        
66. everybody has all 99s in a week or a day.                                                    
67. nobody pks when the adverts say "pking 24/7, best pking"                                                    
68. Server never updates with new content
69. All skills go over 99.
70. ::players command with the old same ass message-.-
71. Servers that claim "24/7 for years to come" and disappear after a week.
72. Firecape minigames that have over 9000 waves
73. Coins to buy from the tzhaar shops instead of Tokkul
74. And don't get me started on trading sticks
75. Command based Grand Exchange that uses deposit boxes
76. Server is easy to hack with cheat engines.
77. Owner phishing your info.
78. Owner is a pedophile.
79. You get banned right after donating.
80. False Donator privileges.
81. Server allows up to 8k users per ip (easy server DC if you have a login bot)
82. The banner says they have something but they say there working on it when there not and there just using it to advertise.
83. Hybrid pvp, hybrid pvp v2, hybrid pvp v3
84. owner uses his shitty computer and claims it to be a 20 gb ram
85. auto clicking theif stalls that give you 1m each
86. Eco runs off a item like party hats and santa's.
87. Erasedpkz summoning
88. server has anything to do with lordy and his leeching skills.
89. dungeoneering where you can click npcs on the other side of the wall and you noclip through them.
90. people pretend to be chicks
91. people who are chicks but wont show :(
92. people who think they are the shit
93. people who donate then think they are better than everybody else
94. servers that promises cookies upon joining and you never get
95. Using smffy, smfforfree, etc To make a forum.
96. Using anything but SMF, IPB, or VB for a forum LOL
97. Giving away free donor to the first three players
98. Doing ::pnpc for no dam reason
99. Haters who ban people when you tell the truth about how crappy their server is
100. Servers that have the really long time to log in
101. Servers that still use silab client
102. When food isn't in a shop
103. When food is in a shop but its not noted
104. When food isn't in a shop but people sell for like 1m each
105. When admins pk on there admins account and use the yell command to try and ridicule you about teleing/running when they can spawn...?
106. When i get a deja vu when seeing a server
107. Owner kills their players so they lose stuff because it's "funny".
108. Owner doesn't know the difference between hard drive space and RAM
109. Owner uses donation money for action figures
110. Players who pretend to be sluttly girls
111. Owner hosts off his Ipad

[/quote]

That list has been used 3 times now I think, excluding the topic it what originally made in. Good thing we made it.[/quote]
Probably all by me :3 I managed to save it the day we made it.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:22, topic:445627”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=548454.msg4022330#msg4022330 date=1340108213]
Change max skill level to like 199 instead of 99. Change xp rate to like 1000 or more. Add awesome items for when you do get to level 199. If a lot of players get max cash stack quickly just make a new item that is worth 1m coins and have them exchangeable.
[/quote]
Going from 1 to 199 takes a shitload of time even with a 1000x EXP rate.[/quote]
Is why you make it 10000x.

And of course ban trading of milk. (All milk in RS in unpasteurized).
And have me lose my job? No thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

Creativity is lacking in servers now-a-days. Most people think OMG I HAVE D CLAWS AND TORVA AND ZURIELS think things like that make a server better which is inadvertently wrong. Good creative content always catches my eye, but I haven’t played a server in ages because of lack of creativity and the greed for money.

An economy is good, but to a point. Not where dragon scimitars are like 500k that’s a bit excessive. But a good economy is essential for enjoyment of players.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

Chassy13:

A Monster energy drink. First one in like 6 months.

I think you’re in the wrong topic, buddy.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Lin:

If the server is focused on one central area, a skilling area is best. There also has to be some sort of guide, and the only way to make money can’t be from clicking stalls for an hour. A good way to communicate with everyone is also great - a yell command is a good example of this. Being unique is also a must. Also the server’s home cannot be in Edgeville. Fuck Edgeville.[/quote][quote=“Si Force, post:15, topic:445627”]Something creative such as quests. It gives the user a sense of purpose and something to work towards. Most servers are very one dimensional, as they only boast raw features such as PK’ing and maybe one other main feature. They have nothing that stands out and shouts ‘HEY STAY HERE’, therefore most people leave those servers within a week.

Small details add up, i.e don’t skip adding something just because you won’t use it or never use it, and then say everyone doesn’t. Also, try and give correct staff powers, i.e, don’t let moderators do everything, they should be able to mute and ban at most, and they should be hand-picked by administrators rather than posting a thread on the forums.

In fact, I find many servers with bad staff un-enjoyable, mostly because if a player moderator has a friend, they can pretty much abuse all they want. That’s because anyone can write an application and suck up in game, but few can actually moderate shit.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

what makes a good rsps?
using the whole rsmap, all ways of travelling, quests :D, minigames, unique features, no rollbacks or dupes or shitloads of bugs, awesome combat, a good community might help, staff know what they should do unlike most retarded,abusive staff on those pi servers, stable,ddos protected, 99% uptime server, and alot of very small things can add up and make your server stand out (i like the small things example: desert effects, cactus cutting, rug travel in al kharid) just brainstormed some shit, might not make alot of sense lmao

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Something creative such as quests. It gives the user a sense of purpose and something to work towards. Most servers are very one dimensional, as they only boast raw features such as PK’ing and maybe one other main feature. They have nothing that stands out and shouts ‘HEY STAY HERE’, therefore most people leave those servers within a week.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

A sure fire way to ensure a good rsps is don’t be donation centred, as I’m doing with Xythax, the user can purchase member(donator) status and that’s it. As long as you don’t have any serious issues with major pieces of content, or dupes or anything like that, then you’ll have a good economy.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If the server is focused on one central area, a skilling area is best. There also has to be some sort of guide, and the only way to make money can’t be from clicking stalls for an hour. A good way to communicate with everyone is also great - a yell command is a good example of this. Being unique is also a must. Also the server’s home cannot be in Edgeville. Fuck Edgeville.

Read full topic

item.title: A good RSPS - Economy
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

ravekitty is right.

In order to make (and what I may attempt to do) a “really good economy” I would try and make like an economy handler, that changes as items are acquired. I think RuneScape has something like this, so does other sources. But then again having it at 1 price could be worth it in some ways, because people would sell to the general store before other players and most likely it wouldn’t be bought therefore basically being wiped out from the game (if your general store deletes things after a certain period of time). That may stall your ptp trading for awhile though…

No massive bonuses for donors is another great way to go. Have their little perks, but don’t make it like most servers out there today, $50 for Dragon (or) Set, $100 for Party Hats, etc, etc. In the server I’m programming at the moment, we’re going to have a few special features for donors, and those won’t necessarily be items. Majority of the items will be able to be accessed by non-donors too.

x7 XP probably isn’t the best way to go… I have an idea for this, but I’m not willing to share it in public (Want it PM me…

People could give 2 shits if the programmings good or not… Look at the servers these days, almost all leeched HyBriD PvPs that lag out every 5 - 10 minutes, yet they have at least 40 players on at a time. So that’s not something that would most likely attract people. As long as you can get it not to lag with maybe like, 300 people online at a time, they’ll be happier than they would be on the one that holds 40 players and dc’s every 5 - 10 minutes.

Don’t make the ways to obtain really rare objects insanely hard. I mean, some people want a challenge (like me) on RSPS, but then there are some of them that make it too much of a challenge that it becomes ridiculous to even get some good items.

Overall, your ideas are fairly decent for making a good economy server. I hope I didn’t leave anything out! :S

Read full topic
